measurement_approach: Ticket count satisfactorily closed by Agent / Rep will be measures alongside the ticket count / costs to identify if the two are closely correlated. MR to increase from 5.2 to 7 by Q2 2026, equivelent to $<need amount> OPEX saving.

Staff Satisfaction surveys will be conducted as we introduce the Agent and train it to work on, first, Low-IP tasks, and provide copilot support to the support representatives. WE CURRENTLY DO NOT HAVE A BASELINE. THIS WILL BE CONDUCTED PRIOR TO GOING LIVE WITH THE AGENT. IMPROVEMENT GOAL TBD.

We will track calls / Agent v calls / Rep and we will ask all callers working with the Agent to leave a short feedback note/rating to determine if this improves their perception of the service. Additonally our normal CSAT surveys will continue.

Zendesk tracks the number of tickets that make use of the AI tools.  We will use this to track adoption of the features as they are added.  We will start small and increase the number as additional features are set up and activated. For October 2025, we are only using the summary and writing tools.

The metric 'Average time to resolve (business hours)' will be tracked for support tickets thru Zendesk Analytics.  The target will be to have the monthly average less than 24 business hours (3 business days)

Once AI Agents are live, we will use Zendesk Analytics to track the percentage of chats that are transferred to a live agent. In Oct 2025, 46% of chats were transferred to a live agent. The goal will be to reduce this to 25% within 12 months after launching Copilot.

Zendesk tracks the tickets that customers mark as self-solved, so we will use this metric to track improvements.  In October 2025, we had 0% self-solved issues reported. Within 9 months of launching the AI Agent, we aim to increase this to 7%.
Track % of users who adopt AI scheduling vs manual methods. Measure AI feature usage vs total scheduling operations. Target: 30% adoption by end of Q2 2026, 60% by Q3, 80%+ by Q4.
Track upgrades to AI-enabled plans, customer retention improvements, and new customer acquisition attributed to AI features. Monitor revenue increase from AI-enhanced product tiers.
Compare time spent before/after AI adoption per facility. Track average schedule creation time reduction. Target: 40% reduction in schedule creation time (hours saved).
Weekly tasks completed.  We currently complete an average of 155 account-related tasks per week and aim to increase that rate to 232 by the end of Q2 2026.
Total # of active automations.  We currently have 23 automations in place, with an additional 40 planned for completion by the end of Q2 2026.

Weekly customer proactive touchpoints (emails, calls, and meetings).  Our goal is to raise weekly outreach from an average of 59 to 78 unique accounts, expanding our engagement reach and pipeline potential by the end of April 2026.
